public AzRequestContextImpl()
Method Detail

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Description copied from interface: AzRequestContext
Get a local non-XACML implementation-specific id that can be used to distinguish this AzRequestContext object from other AzRequestContext objects. This is primarily intended to be an id used for azapi implementations to assist in identifying and referencing AzRequestContext objects where object references may not be readily available such as support for legacy PDP callback implementations.

Specified by:
getId in interface AzRequestContext
Returns:
a String containing an identifier associated with this AzRequestContext object.

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & AzCategoryId> java.util.Set<AzEntity<? extends AzCategoryId>> getAzEntitySet(T t)
Note: The returned Set> is the direct impl of the stored variables: actions, resources, etc., and probably the variable to which it returns needs to be declared as such when this method is used.

Returns:

getAzEntity

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & AzCategoryId> AzEntity<T> getAzEntity(T t)
Description copied from interface: AzRequestContext
Gets an AzEntity<T> object from the internal collection holding AzEntity objects of specified type provided by the parameter, t.

If there is more than one object in the collection it is indeterminate which one is returned. To search the collection when it contains multiple members use AzRequestContext.getAzEntitySet(Enum) which provides a Set that can be examined with an Iterator.

Specified by:
getAzEntity in interface AzRequestContext
Returns:
an AzEntity<T> object

removeSubject

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & AzCategoryId> boolean removeSubject(T t)
Description copied from interface: AzRequestContext
Removes the AzSubject, if one exists, with the specified AzCategoryId. If no AzSubjects remain, AzRequestContext provides empty Subject element for input. i.e. Subject element will always be provided, even if empty.

Specified by:
removeSubject in interface AzRequestContext
Returns:
boolean true if object found and removed, ow false

createAndAddResourceActionAssociation

public AzResourceActionAssociation createAndAddResourceActionAssociation(AzEntity<AzCategoryIdResource> azResource,
                                                                         AzEntity<AzCategoryIdAction> azAction)
Add the Resource and Action pair to the RequestCtx. . The Action and Resource entities MUST have an attribute with AttributeId set to the distinguished constant RequestId and ActionId. Else throw an MissingRequestIdException/MissingActionIdException.

Specified by:
createAndAddResourceActionAssociation in interface AzRequestContext
Parameters:
azResource -
azAction -
Returns:
a reference to the newly created azResourceActionAssociation, which may be used to correlate with a specific returned azResult.
See Also:
AzResourceActionAssociation, AzResult

addResourceActionAssociation

public java.util.Set<AzResourceActionAssociation> addResourceActionAssociation(java.util.Set<AzEntity<AzCategoryIdResource>> azResourceSet,
                                                                               java.util.Set<AzEntity<AzCategoryIdAction>> azActionSet)
Add the cross-product of the Resource and Action sets to the RequestCtx. The Action and Resource entities MUST have an attribute with AttributeId set to the distinguished constant RequestId and ActionId respectively. Else throw an MissingRequestIdException/MissingActionIdException.

Specified by:
addResourceActionAssociation in interface AzRequestContext
Parameters:
azResourceSet -
azActionSet -
Returns:
the Set objects that were just added to the collection
See Also:
AzRequestContext.createAndAddResourceActionAssociation(AzEntity, AzEntity)
